item.title: Obfuscating IDs
item.description: Auto-incrementing IDs are great. When you’re picking a method for generating unique IDs in a system, auto-incrementing IDs (1, 2, 3, …) are often a good choice. These have a number of advantages over more complicated techniques: They are very fast to generate and require no random number generation or seeding. Their representation is short and simple compared to e.g. GUIDs. There is no need to test for collisions or uniqueness.
